intro: Aneilema vitiense, commonly known as the Vitiense Aneilema, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and calla lilies. The plant features arrow-shaped leaves and produces striking, spatulate-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and green. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure. Aneilema vitiense thrives in humid, shaded environments and is commonly found in forest understories.
